content:
Dear,
Is there any forecast for Forge R5 to have all the resourses profilers and datatype profilers available to use?

Also replied by email, but for completeness:

With our Firely FHIR tooling we try to follow the official FHIR releases as closely as possible:

  • Currently the latest stable FHIR release is FHIR R4
  • The version FHIR R4B is its final stages of being released, mainly making changes in the medication and evidence-based medicine space of the specification
  • The stable release of FHIR R5 is not expected until Q1-2 2022

As such the current stable versions of Forge (https://simplifier.net/forge) include STU3 and R4 and the R5 version will remain a preview release until R5 is officially released.
Actually, based on the most recent balloting timeline, FHIR R5 is most likely looking at Q3 2022.
And tooling that supports it would presumably be late Q4 or early 2023

Lloyd McKenzie said:

Actually, based on the most recent balloting timeline, FHIR R5 is most likely looking at Q3 2022.

@Lloyd McKenzie is this still the case? Where can we I find the resources that are beeing balloted for R5? Which ones will be normative in R5?

Everything is being balloted in R5. The resources that are eligible to go normative in R5 are listed here: http://www.hl7.org/Special/committees/tsc/ballotmanagement/DisplayNIB.cfm?ballot_document_sdo_id=1213, though some of these will probably be dropped to STU.

Because we're now only balloting in May, publication is now likely Q4 2022.
